html: Something is fundamentally broken in our society when any house of worship is made unsafe by gun violence and hate—again and again and again. I’m keeping Poway and the entire Jewish community in my prayers. More than that, I don’t accept this. We must end this epidemic.

html: At our @KeeneState_ town hall, a voter asked how I plan to close the wealth gap. text:
At our @KeeneState_ town hall, a voter asked how I plan to close the wealth gap. Some of the ideas I shared were:
• Establishing postal banking
• Raising the minimum wage
• Passing national paid leave
• Full employment through skills trainingpic.twitter.com/Wg7njwp3qU – at Keene State College Alumni Center

html: If we don't learn from Russia's cyber attacks on our election in 2016, they'll do it again. And we can't depend on President Trump to stop them. So I created a pledge to defend our democracy, and I'm asking all of my fellow 2020 candidates to join me. http://kirstengillibrand.com/cybersecurity pic.twitter.com/joW0jn9SvH

html: Fran and Jason Parr showed me around their home to see the unbelievable flood damage in Pacific Junction, IA. It’s heartbreaking, but they and their community aren’t broken down. They’re rallying to lift each other up and rebuild. And I told Fran I’d be back this summer to help.pic.twitter.com/scvVJaceYP

html: As I travel around the country, the number-one fear on people’s minds is often this: If they or someone in their family get seriously sick or injured, how are they going to pay for it? Let’s get this done for Americans and end that fear. We need Medicare For All.
text:
As I travel around the country, the number-one fear on people’s minds is often this: If they or someone in their family get seriously sick or injured, how are they going to pay for it?
 
Let’s get this done for Americans and end that fear. We need Medicare For All.

html: It's unacceptable for CEOs to stack up profits while working families struggle. I stand with the #StopandShop workers striking in New England to fight back against cuts to their wages and health care.
text: It's unacceptable for CEOs to stack up profits while working families struggle. I stand with the #StopandShop workers striking in New England to fight back against cuts to their wages and health care.

html: Medicare For All is an ambitious goal. But we also need a plan for how to get there, and I have one: Under my transition plan, we'd create a public option and force insurance companies to compete. That's how we can lower costs and get to universal health care.
text: Medicare For All is an ambitious goal. But we also need a plan for how to get there, and I have one: Under my transition plan, we'd create a public option and force insurance companies to compete. That's how we can lower costs and get to universal health care.

html: Years from now, we will look back on this moment in our history, and we’ll be able to say that we did something about it. We stood up, locked arms and proved to America—and the world—that when people come together to drive out darkness, hope rises. Fear loses. And #BraveWins.
text:
Years from now, we will look back on this moment in our history, and we’ll be able to say that we did something about it.

We stood up, locked arms and proved to America—and the world—that when people come together to drive out darkness, hope rises.

Fear loses.

And #BraveWins.

html: None of these big fights will be easy. But I’ve never backed down from a fight for what’s right, and I’m not about to start now. That’s why I’m in this race. I'm running for president to fix what’s been broken, repair our moral fabric and rebuild our common bonds. #BraveWins
text:
None of these big fights will be easy. But I’ve never backed down from a fight for what’s right, and I’m not about to start now.

That’s why I’m in this race. I'm running for president to fix what’s been broken, repair our moral fabric and rebuild our common bonds.

#BraveWins

html: We need to treat climate change like the existential threat it is and pass a #GreenNewDeal. Let’s make it our generation’s moonshot. Addressing a global challenge of this urgency will take massive effort and transformative vision—which is exactly why we should do it. #BraveWins
text:
We need to treat climate change like the existential threat it is and pass a #GreenNewDeal. Let’s make it our generation’s moonshot. Addressing a global challenge of this urgency will take massive effort and transformative vision—which is exactly why we should do it.

#BraveWins

html: We must hold accountable any threats to our democracy. The Mueller report must be made public. Nobody is above the law. I don’t often agree with Richard Nixon, but he was right to say the American people have a right to know whether or not their president is a crook. #BraveWins
text:
We must hold accountable any threats to our democracy.

The Mueller report must be made public. Nobody is above the law. I don’t often agree with Richard Nixon, but he was right to say the American people have a right to know whether or not their president is a crook.

#BraveWins

html: We need to restore our moral leadership in the world. We must secure our borders effectively and fight terrorism relentlessly, but let’s be very clear: Racism and fear are not a national security strategy. #BraveWins
text:
We need to restore our moral leadership in the world. We must secure our borders effectively and fight terrorism relentlessly, but let’s be very clear: Racism and fear are not a national security strategy.

#BraveWins

html: We need to dismantle institutional racism. We need solutions both targeted and broad—like higher standards for maternity care, a national commitment to full employment, postal banking, ending cash bail and legalizing marijuana. #BraveWins
text:
We need to dismantle institutional racism.
 
We need solutions both targeted and broad—like higher standards for maternity care, a national commitment to full employment, postal banking, ending cash bail and legalizing marijuana.

#BraveWins

html: Hear me when I say this: Paid leave, equal pay and affordable daycare are not just “women’s issues.” These are economic issues—ones that will determine whether or not our country succeeds. #BraveWins
text:
Hear me when I say this: Paid leave, equal pay and affordable daycare are not just “women’s issues.” These are economic issues—ones that will determine whether or not our country succeeds. 

#BraveWins

html: Our goals are ambitious, but they shouldn't be controversial: Medicare for all. Universal pre-K and high-quality public education. Affordable college. Full employment. A $15 minimum wage. National paid leave. #BraveWins
text:
Our goals are ambitious, but they shouldn't be controversial:

Medicare for all.
Universal pre-K and high-quality public education.
Affordable college.
Full employment.
A $15 minimum wage.
National paid leave.

#BraveWins

html: As president, I will fight for publicly-funded federal elections. It would change the way Washington works overnight. Imagine your voice being just as loud as the Koch brothers—what a concept! We have to level the political playing field so our democracy can thrive. #BraveWins
text:
As president, I will fight for publicly-funded federal elections. It would change the way Washington works overnight. Imagine your voice being just as loud as the Koch brothers—what a concept!

We have to level the political playing field so our democracy can thrive.

#BraveWins

html: Right now, special interests are displacing the voices of the people in our democracy. Find me a so-called unsolvable problem, and I'll point you to the greed and corruption in the way. We need to crack open our government, flip the switch and let the light flood in. #BraveWins
text:
Right now, special interests are displacing the voices of the people in our democracy. Find me a so-called unsolvable problem, and I'll point you to the greed and corruption in the way.

We need to crack open our government, flip the switch and let the light flood in.

#BraveWins

html: I’m fighting for an America where where compassion and integrity define our government, not self-interest and corruption. Where we don’t just care about the profits we make today, but the future we’re leaving to our grandchildren. I know we can be that America. #BraveWins
text:
I’m fighting for an America where where compassion and integrity define our government, not self-interest and corruption. Where we don’t just care about the profits we make today, but the future we’re leaving to our grandchildren.

I know we can be that America.

#BraveWins

html: I stood up to greed and voted against the bank bailout. I stood up to corruption in Congress. I stood up to the Pentagon, Congress and colleges on behalf of survivors of sexual assault. And I’m proud to have stood up to Trump more than anyone else in the Senate. #BraveWins
text:
I stood up to greed and voted against the bank bailout.

I stood up to corruption in Congress.

I stood up to the Pentagon, Congress and colleges on behalf of survivors of sexual assault.
 
And I’m proud to have stood up to Trump more than anyone else in the Senate.

#BraveWins

html: My grandmother Polly taught me that being brave doesn’t just mean standing up for yourself—it means standing up for other people who need you. Bravery means standing up to the powerful, and summoning the courage to confront them head on. And that's what I've done. #BraveWins
text:
My grandmother Polly taught me that being brave doesn’t just mean standing up for yourself—it means standing up for other people who need you. 

Bravery means standing up to the powerful, and summoning the courage to confront them head on. And that's what I've done.

#BraveWins

html: Day in and day out, Americans are making a choice to resist the backward pull of this administration, and pushing us toward a better future. The people of this country deserve a president worthy of your bravery. That's why I’m running for president. #BraveWins
text:
Day in and day out, Americans are making a choice to resist the backward pull of this administration, and pushing us toward a better future.

The people of this country deserve a president worthy of your bravery. That's why I’m running for president.

#BraveWins

html: We deserve a president who is brave. A president who inspires us to stand for something greater than ourselves. We don’t build walls; we build bridges. Because our unity of purpose lifts us higher than any tower. #BraveWins
text:
We deserve a president who is brave. A president who inspires us to stand for something greater than ourselves.

We don’t build walls; we build bridges. Because our unity of purpose lifts us higher than any tower.

#BraveWins

html: President Trump is tearing apart the moral fabric of this country. He demonizes the vulnerable and he punches down. He puts his name in bold on every building. He does all of this because he wants us to believe he is strong. He is not. Our President is a coward. #BraveWins
text:
President Trump is tearing apart the moral fabric of this country. He demonizes the vulnerable and he punches down. He puts his name in bold on every building.

He does all of this because he wants us to believe he is strong. He is not. Our President is a coward.

#BraveWins

html: Brave isn’t winning right now. Brave doesn’t spread hate or bully the vulnerable. Brave doesn’t put greed and self-interest over millions of lives. Brave doesn’t cower behind lies and walls. Brave doesn’t pit people against one another. That’s what fear does. #BraveWins
text:
Brave isn’t winning right now.

Brave doesn’t spread hate or bully the vulnerable. 
Brave doesn’t put greed and self-interest over millions of lives. 
Brave doesn’t cower behind lies and walls. 
Brave doesn’t pit people against one another. That’s what fear does.

#BraveWins

Her bravery helped kickstart a national movement to end sexual assault on campuses. #BraveWinspic.twitter.com/ltjQtnZjiP

html: Let's put aside the overreaching, fake national emergency for a minute. How does Trump intend to pay for his pointless wall and tax cuts for millionaires? By cutting $845 billion from Medicare, $26B from Social Security, and $200B from student loan programs. It's all wrong.
text: Let's put aside the overreaching, fake national emergency for a minute. How does Trump intend to pay for his pointless wall and tax cuts for millionaires? By cutting $845 billion from Medicare, $26B from Social Security, and $200B from student loan programs. It's all wrong.

html: The best way to provide national paid leave is to make it an earned benefit, just like Social Security. Under my plan, you and your employer would each pay in $2/week, and you'd get 12 weeks of paid leave. It's that simple.pic.twitter.com/ur6CTdQnoU
text: The best way to provide national paid leave is to make it an earned benefit, just like Social Security. Under my plan, you and your employer would each pay in $2/week, and you'd get 12 weeks of paid leave. It's that simple.pic.twitter.com/ur6CTdQnoU

html: Health care should be a right, not a privilege. We need a president who'll fight for universal, quality coverage that's affordable for everybody. I believe we need #MedicareForAll, and that we should create a public option as a transition to single-payer. #GillibrandTownHall

html: Rewarding work means a few things to me: We need to support unions and workers' rights. We need to raise the minimum wage to $15. We need to invest in job training. We need national paid leave. And we need to punish companies who outsource American jobs. #GillibrandTownHall
text:
Rewarding work means a few things to me:
We need to support unions and workers' rights.
We need to raise the minimum wage to $15.
We need to invest in job training.
We need national paid leave. 
And we need to punish companies who outsource American jobs. #GillibrandTownHall

html: America is facing an opioid crisis, and one of the ways we need to put a stop to it is by holding opioid makers accountable for their greed. They knowingly put their profits over people's lives, and they should be prosecuted. #GillibrandTownHall
text: America is facing an opioid crisis, and one of the ways we need to put a stop to it is by holding opioid makers accountable for their greed. They knowingly put their profits over people's lives, and they should be prosecuted. #GillibrandTownHall

html: We need to get money out of politics because the way Washington works is that the powerful have unlimited power, and money is the name of the game. If we want change, we need to stand up to the powerful special interests and restore the people's voices. #GillibrandTownHall

html: #InternationalWomensDay is more than a celebration—it's also a call to action. As far as we've come, we still have barriers to tear down so we can all have equal opportunity and respect. Let's keep marching, and with every step, let's reach back and pull others up with us.

html: I’ve introduced the #FAMILYAct in every Congress since 2013 to establish universal paid leave, and finally cover the 83% of workers who don't have it now. It's far past time to be a country that truly supports working families. Let's make this a priority, and make it happen.
text: I’ve introduced the #FAMILYAct in every Congress since 2013 to establish universal paid leave, and finally cover the 83% of workers who don't have it now. It's far past time to be a country that truly supports working families. Let's make this a priority, and make it happen.

html: Universal paid leave isn’t unaffordable or unattainable. The #FAMILYAct would create a national insurance program, giving workers 12 weeks of paid leave to care for a new child, sick family member or their own health issues—all for about the cost of a cup of coffee a week.
text: Universal paid leave isn’t unaffordable or unattainable. The #FAMILYAct would create a national insurance program, giving workers 12 weeks of paid leave to care for a new child, sick family member or their own health issues—all for about the cost of a cup of coffee a week.

html: Did you know America is the only developed country in the world without any kind of national paid leave program? The only one. We're the only industrialized nation that leaves workers the impossible choice between a paycheck and caring for their families. We’ve got to fix this.
text: Did you know America is the only developed country in the world without any kind of national paid leave program? The only one. We're the only industrialized nation that leaves workers the impossible choice between a paycheck and caring for their families. We’ve got to fix this.

html: As we celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth, I'm inspired by so many heroes of our past AND present. But I'm also thinking about my grandma, and the millions of ordinary women who've inspired us and made our history. It's their shoulders we're standing on too—let's make them proud.
text: As we celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth, I'm inspired by so many heroes of our past AND present. But I'm also thinking about my grandma, and the millions of ordinary women who've inspired us and made our history. It's their shoulders we're standing on too—let's make them proud.

html: So many voices tell women and girls to doubt ourselves. Seeing brave, strong women batting that away and setting their own course can change everything. That was my grandma for me. I want more girls and women to see that there's nothing we can't do, and nowhere we don't belong.
text: So many voices tell women and girls to doubt ourselves. Seeing brave, strong women batting that away and setting their own course can change everything. That was my grandma for me. I want more girls and women to see that there's nothing we can't do, and nowhere we don't belong.

html: My grandma has been the inspiration behind so much of my life, from my first run for Congress to starting @getots to deciding to run for president. She never let anyone tell her she couldn't, or that she didn't belong, or that she didn't have value—and she taught me the same.
text: My grandma has been the inspiration behind so much of my life, from my first run for Congress to starting @getots to deciding to run for president. She never let anyone tell her she couldn't, or that she didn't belong, or that she didn't have value—and she taught me the same.

html: My grandma took one look at the old boys' club of upstate New York politics and instead of knocking or even kicking down the door, she went and built her own clubhouse. She founded the Albany Democratic Women's Club when there weren't supposed to be women in politics at all.
text: My grandma took one look at the old boys' club of upstate New York politics and instead of knocking or even kicking down the door, she went and built her own clubhouse. She founded the Albany Democratic Women's Club when there weren't supposed to be women in politics at all.

html: My grandma, Polly, was one of those ordinary-extraordinary women. She was my hero. It's because of her that I spent a lot of my childhood sitting at a table in a Democratic campaign office, stuffing envelopes with women who were doing what they could to improve their community.pic.twitter.com/0fjuV1DDWG
text: My grandma, Polly, was one of those ordinary-extraordinary women. She was my hero. It's because of her that I spent a lot of my childhood sitting at a table in a Democratic campaign office, stuffing envelopes with women who were doing what they could to improve their community.pic.twitter.com/0fjuV1DDWG

html: If you ask me, #WomensHistoryMonth should run all year. Women's history is America's history, no matter how much or little it's told. It's the story of leaders, workers, mothers and organizers who made a difference. Ordinary women who did extraordinary things.

html: Every year, we salute the heroes who saved lives after 9/11. But as cancer rates and deaths spike, the Victim Compensation Fund is about to expire—and if we don't renew it, we're turning our back on those heroes. We need to #Renew911VCF and make it permanent now.

Let's stop talking about more time, and take action now.

html: I want to remind my Republican colleagues: We are elected to represent the American people, not the president. Our clean bill to fund the government—without funding a $5.7B, ridiculous wall—fell just short today. Let's put working families first and open the government.
text:

html: In the nine years since the Citizens United ruling, unaccountable money has eroded our democracy. As long as candidates continue to accept corporate PAC and federal lobbyist donations, we can't fix what's broken. One person, one vote. It's time to overturn Citizens United.
text:
In the nine years since the Citizens United ruling, unaccountable money has eroded our democracy. As long as candidates continue to accept corporate PAC and federal lobbyist donations, we can't fix what's broken.

One person, one vote. It's time to overturn Citizens United.

html: The fact that black men and women do not earn a dollar on the dollar in the workplace as a white man has to be my fight too. Because if I really care about every child as much as I do my own, then these are my fights to help overcome too.

html: The fact that a black woman in New York City is 12 times more likely to die in childbirth is outrageous, and it's all of our responsibility to fix that. The fact that a young black or brown man is 10 times more likely to be arrested for marijuana possession is all of our burden.
text: The fact that a black woman in New York City is 12 times more likely to die in childbirth is outrageous, and it's all of our responsibility to fix that. The fact that a young black or brown man is 10 times more likely to be arrested for marijuana possession is all of our burden.

html: Fighting racism and injustice will take all of us — it cannot be left to people of color alone. White people like me need to take up our part of this burden, and commit to using our voices to amplify those that have been ignored and silenced for too long.
text: Fighting racism and injustice will take all of us — it cannot be left to people of color alone. White people like me need to take up our part of this burden, and commit to using our voices to amplify those that have been ignored and silenced for too long.

html: Today, so many decades after Dr. King's assassination, we need more than ever to have an honest conversation about racism: not just individual acts, but the systemic, institutional racism infecting our society — our healthcare, education, criminal justice system, and economy.
text: Today, so many decades after Dr. King's assassination, we need more than ever to have an honest conversation about racism: not just individual acts, but the systemic, institutional racism infecting our society — our healthcare, education, criminal justice system, and economy.

html: As we honor Dr. King today, we should all think, What am I doing with MY own time here on this earth to serve others? Because he taught us that serving others is the greatest purpose in life. And as he said, “The time is always right to do what is right.”

html: Dr. King continues to inspire us because he believed in values that transcend time and movements: He believed in right vs. wrong; that only light can drive out darkness; that we're all called to fight for others, because an injustice against one is an injustice against all.

html: This is a moment in history when none of us can stay silent. We have to rise up and reclaim our values. At such a time as this, we all have to ask ourselves: What will we do? I’ll fight, and I’ll fight with everything I have. It would mean so much if you joined me.
text:
This is a moment in history when none of us can stay silent. We have to rise up and reclaim our values. At such a time as this, we all have to ask ourselves: What will we do?

I’ll fight, and I’ll fight with everything I have. It would mean so much if you joined me.

html: Our movement is about lifting voices that have been ignored for too long. That means taking institutional racism and injustice head-on – in our politics, health care, education and economy. Let's show what we can build with determination and optimism, rather than hatred and fear.
text: Our movement is about lifting voices that have been ignored for too long. That means taking institutional racism and injustice head-on – in our politics, health care, education and economy. Let's show what we can build with determination and optimism, rather than hatred and fear.

html: The campaign we're building will have one core mission: restoring power to people. I won’t accept contributions from corporate PACs or federal lobbyists, and I'm not afraid to take on Trump, special interests or any powerful system – never have been.
text: The campaign we're building will have one core mission: restoring power to people. I won’t accept contributions from corporate PACs or federal lobbyists, and I'm not afraid to take on Trump, special interests or any powerful system – never have been.

html: I believe this country needs a movement rooted in compassion and courage. We want an America defined by strength of character, not weakness of ego. We need to protect our basic rights and fight for better health care, education and jobs. And I believe I'm the woman for the job.

The emergency at our border is the cruel treatment of children who are still detained. It’s the asylum seekers being shut out. It’s @realDonaldTrump’s dehumanizing attacks on immigrants in need.

We need to end the shutdown and get back to solving real problems families face.

html: These are critical issues that would make the lives of families across the country better. But instead of working toward progress, the president is creating an unnecessary crisis by holding the government hostage. This shutdown needs to end. Now.

html: Strengthening the environmental protections that combat climate change, preserve our access to clean air and water and protect our planet’s future for our children and grandchildren.

html: Passing gun reform legislation to curb gun trafficking, ban automatic assault weapons and institute universal background checks to keep our loved ones safe.

html: President Trump is using the American people as a bargaining chip, and his shutdown is holding our government hostage: Instead of wasting time discussing his wasteful, ineffective border wall, here are all the issues Congress could be tackling instead:
text: President Trump is using the American people as a bargaining chip, and his shutdown is holding our government hostage: Instead of wasting time discussing his wasteful, ineffective border wall, here are all the issues Congress could be tackling instead:

html: This has officially become the longest shutdown in American history. Enough. If @realDonaldTrump wants to have a real conversation about border security, he needs to reopen the government.
text: This has officially become the longest shutdown in American history. Enough. If @realDonaldTrump wants to have a real conversation about border security, he needs to reopen the government.

html: It’s time for the president to stop playing politics with people’s lives and reopen the government. This has to end.
text: It’s time for the president to stop playing politics with people’s lives and reopen the government. This has to end.

html: Because of the shutdown, nearly 248,000 veterans have no guarantee of pay – many of whom joined the federal workforce to continue the service they began in the military. This is an insult to their patriotism and the sacrifices they’ve made to keep our country safe.
text: Because of the shutdown, nearly 248,000 veterans have no guarantee of pay – many of whom joined the federal workforce to continue the service they began in the military. This is an insult to their patriotism and the sacrifices they’ve made to keep our country safe.

html: With no telling when they’ll receive a paycheck, many TSA officers have had to resign so they can pursue other jobs to pay for rent and child care. While Trump stokes fear about the crisis at the border, he’s created a real security risk at transit hubs across the country.
text: With no telling when they’ll receive a paycheck, many TSA officers have had to resign so they can pursue other jobs to pay for rent and child care. While Trump stokes fear about the crisis at the border, he’s created a real security risk at transit hubs across the country.

html: The FDA has stopped inspecting food for salmonella, E. coli and listeria. The EPA is unable to monitor dangerous chemicals and pollutants. And the only way these agencies can resume protecting our health and safety is to force their employees to work without pay.

html: Making a berry cobbler to bring to my friends’ house for New Year's dinner! It’s my favorite. Here's my usual recipe, but this time I used 2 tbs lemon juice, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 cup sugar for the filling. And for the topping I used gluten free muesli for my oats!pic.twitter.com/k8jiF7WMUr
text:
Making a berry cobbler to bring to my friends’ house for New Year's dinner! It’s my favorite.

Here's my usual recipe, but this time I used 2 tbs lemon juice, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 cup sugar for the filling. And for the topping I used gluten free muesli for my oats!pic.twitter.com/k8jiF7WMUr

html: We’ve seen the nightmare of gun violence repeat itself in schools, movie theaters, churches, nightclubs, concerts – and every single day in cities across our country. Despite these tragedies, we’re still seeing the same thing from Congress: complete inaction. Enough is enough.
text: We’ve seen the nightmare of gun violence repeat itself in schools, movie theaters, churches, nightclubs, concerts – and every single day in cities across our country. Despite these tragedies, we’re still seeing the same thing from Congress: complete inaction. Enough is enough.

html: Today we remember the 20 children and 6 educators who were killed by a gunman at Sandy Hook Elementary six years ago. My heart is with every family who has spent the last six years grappling with the heartbreak of losing a loved one. And all the while, Congress has failed to act.

html: Across New York, the country and the globe, the signs of climate change are everywhere, and it’s on us to pay attention. It’s not too late to take the necessary steps to preserve our planet, but our action has to be immediate.
text: Across New York, the country and the globe, the signs of climate change are everywhere, and it’s on us to pay attention. It’s not too late to take the necessary steps to preserve our planet, but our action has to be immediate.

html: Real paid leave extends beyond maternity leave: It would allow people to take care of a sick loved one or take time to recover from an injury. No one should have to choose between being there for a loved one and missing a paycheck. Not in America. Not anymore.

html: Today is #WorldAIDSDay – a day when we come together and renew our commitment to fighting this disease by ensuring everyone has access to the preventative resources and treatment they deserve. Click here to learn more about how to get tested for HIV: https://knowyourstatus.unaids.org/

html: On this day in 1955, Rosa Parks refused to move bus seats just because she was a black woman, sparking the bus boycott that eventually ended bus segregation. As we fight against continued inequality and discrimination today, we can all be inspired by the courage of Rosa Parks.pic.twitter.com/FBMB9EFdp4

html: President George H.W. Bush’s life will forever be defined by his deep commitment to public service and to the values of our nation. His legacy will never be forgotten. May he rest in peace. Sending my love and deepest condolences to the Bush family.

html: Shirley Chisholm, the first black woman to serve in Congress, was born 94 years ago on this day. She reminds us all “if they don’t give you a seat at the table, bring a folding chair.” Let’s celebrate Chisholm by continuing to raise our voices and make ourselves heard.

html: A woman’s right to a safe abortion has been threatened repeatedly. But we’ve learned during this administration that together, we’re stronger than anything President Trump or his officials can throw at us. As long as we give this fight our all, they don’t stand a chance.

html: Ensuring women get equal pay is crucial, but we won’t close the wage gap without also passing a paid family leave plan. html: From the GOP’s tax cuts for the wealthiest few to their refusal to address the gun violence that’s devastated our country, it’s all about who lines their pockets. We must get dark money’s toxic influence out of politics in order to fix our corroded and corrupt system.

html: Emma Lazarus’s poem on the Statue of Liberty promises an America defined by hope and refuge for all who are in need. This is the founding principle of our country. One that President Trump has turned his back on. One we must fight to hold onto.pic.twitter.com/RNKHOckfRw

html: There are no more excuses. We must end America’s support for Saudi Arabia’s war in Yemen — a humanitarian disaster. Yesterday’s Senate vote was an important step forward, and I urge my colleagues to pass this bipartisan resolution on the floor.
text: There are no more excuses. We must end America’s support for Saudi Arabia’s war in Yemen — a humanitarian disaster. Yesterday’s Senate vote was an important step forward, and I urge my colleagues to pass this bipartisan resolution on the floor.

html: Health care enrollment under the Affordable Care Act is open right now through Dec. 15. Don’t miss your chance to sign up for the health insurance plan that best fits your needs at http://healthcare.gov .

html: Health care is a universal right, but President Trump and Republicans in Congress treat it like the privilege of a few. Every time they place the profits of insurance companies over people’s access to affordable, quality care, we must fight back with everything we’ve got.

html: Studies have shown that climate change is contributing to extreme weather events becoming more severe and frequent – and we can take action against climate change. How many more homes and communities must be devastated before we do something? The time to act is now.

html: As prescription drug costs skyrocket, seniors are forced to choose between paying their bills or paying for their medicine. Congress cannot let this happen.https://twitter.com/AARPadvocates/status/1064201570546536453 …
